headline.main: NBC Overhauls Prime Time, Benching 'Community' and 'Prime Suspect'

docs.abstract: 'Whitney' is being moved to Wednesday nights, replaced on Thursday by "Up All Night."
docs.snippet: 'Whitney' is being moved to Wednesday nights, replaced on Thursday by "Up All Night."

docs.lead_paragraph: Facing problems on almost every night of the week, NBC announced wholesale changes to its prime-time schedule Monday, which were focused mainly on strengthening two nights, Mondays and Thursdays.

docs.abstract: For the millions of Americans who suffer from mild to severe winter blues, bright-light therapy is the treatment of choice, with response rates comparable with those of antidepressants
docs.snippet: For the millions of Americans who suffer from mild to severe winter blues, bright-light therapy is the treatment of choice, with response rates comparable with those of antidepressants

docs.lead_paragraph: For the millions of Americans who suffer from mild to severe winter blues - a condition called seasonal affective disorder, or S.A.D. - bright-light therapy is the treatment of choice, with response rates comparable with those of antidepressants, reports today's Consumer column.

docs.abstract: In a bid to expand its digital footprint, the Walt Disney Company announced on Monday that it had purchased Babble Media, an online site for parents that features hundreds of bloggers.

headline.main: On a Mountaintop, Dreaming of the Next Step

docs.abstract: The author ponders life choices -- a way to contribute, mainly -- as she and her family rough it in their rented winter cabin in the woods.
docs.snippet: The author ponders life choices -- a way to contribute, mainly -- as she and her family rough it in their rented winter cabin in the woods.

docs.lead_paragraph: As some of you may know, we're a family of five who embarked in July on a year of living in the Maine woods, relocating from our house in the New Jersey suburbs. We spent the first few months off the grid on a lake in the north woods, and we've been in what we call the "winter house" for about five weeks now. (As an aside, we are renters, not owners, in Maine.)

docs.lead_paragraph: MAHONY--Robert C.,age 92, of Bronxville, NY, formerly of Riverdale, NY, died Saturday, November 12, 2011 in his home. Husband to Doris Sullivan and father to Barbara Weaver, Robert J. Mahony, Michael P. Mahony, Maureen Casper, and Mary Jo Flynn, he was most proud of the 42 children, grandchildren and great-grandchildren that he took direct responsibility for producing. An active parishioner of St Joseph's Catholic Church in Bronxville for over 30 years (formerly of St. Margaret's in Riverdale for some 60 years), he taught CCD and was a lector and daily communicant. He was a Eucharistic Minister for his parish, visiting the sick at their homes and at Lawrence Hospital where he volunteered for many years. He took great joy in volunteering at the Pregnancy Care Center in New Rochelle where he walked and played with the children under their care. Robert ran the J.G. Mahony Company, Inc., insurance brokerage firm up until 2010, a firm his father established, and was on the Board of Directors of Anchor Savings Bank, Dime Savings Bank, and The Schervier Nursing Care Center in the Bronx, NY. He is survived by his brother, Richard Mahony, and sister, Catherine Howett. Calling Hours at the Fred H. McGrath & Son Funeral Home, Bronxville between the hours of 4-7pm Sunday and 2-4 and 7-9pm Monday. Mass of Christian Burial St. Joseph's Church, Bronxville on Tuesday, November 15 at 10am.
